snippet: The Commerce Department said that retail sales edged up 0.1 percent last month, held back by declines in receipts at furniture, electronic and appliance stores.
abstract: Commerce Department says that retail sales barely rose in April, edging up 0.1 percent, tempering hopes of sharp acceleration in economic growth in second quarter.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department said that retail sales edged up 0.1 percent last month, held back by declines in receipts at furniture, electronic and appliance stores.

headline.main: U.S. Retail Sales Rise Slightly, Far Below Expectations
headline.print_headline: U.S. Retail Sales Rise Slightly, Missing Forecasts
